skill.name: brand-guidelines
skill.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit from having Anthropic's look-and-feel. Use it when brand colors or style guidelines, visual formatting, or company design standards apply.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only brand guidelines documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or environment variable access detected. The skill provides only informational content about Anthropic brand colors and typography.

content.value_statement: You need to apply consistent brand colors and typography to documents or presentations. This skill provides official Anthropic brand guidelines including colors, fonts, and styling rules to ensure on-brand visual output.
actual_capabilities: Apply Anthropic main brand colors (dark, light, mid gray, light gray)
Apply Anthropic accent colors (orange, blue, green)
Apply Poppins font to headings with Arial fallback
Apply Lora font to body text with Georgia fallback
Apply smart color selection based on background
Apply accent colors to non-text shapes and elements
limitations: Only provides Anthropic brand guidelines (no other brands)
Does not install fonts in your environment
Does not automatically modify files (AI must use guidelines manually)
Best results require pre-installed Poppins and Lora fonts

use_cases.title: Format On-Brand Documents

prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic brand styling to my presentation including colors for backgrounds, text, and accent shapes

prompt_templates.title: Font Fallback Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: How should I apply Anthropic typography when Poppins and Lora fonts are not available on the system?

output_examples.input: Apply Anthropic brand colors to my presentation
output: Main colors: Dark #141413, Light #faf9f5, Mid Gray #b0aea5, Light Gray #e8e6dc
Headings: Poppins font (Arial fallback for 24pt+ text)
Text colors: Use dark (#141413) on light backgrounds or light (#faf9f5) on dark backgrounds

best_practices: Pre-install Poppins and Lora fonts for optimal brand representation
Use dark (#141413) text on light (#faf9f5) backgrounds for best contrast
Apply accent colors to non-text elements to maintain visual hierarchy
anti_patterns: Using non-Anthropic colors when brand consistency is required
Ignoring font fallback options that reduce readability
Applying accent colors to text elements instead of shapes

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides brand guidelines that any AI assistant can follow.

faq.question: What are the main Anthropic brand colors?
faq.answer: The main colors are dark (#141413), light (#faf9f5), mid gray (#b0aea5), and light gray (#e8e6dc).

faq.question: What fonts does Anthropic use?
faq.answer: Anthropic uses Poppins for headings (24pt and larger) and Lora for body text. Arial and Georgia are fallback options.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides static brand guidelines. It does not access files, network, or system resources.

faq.question: Why do fonts not appear correctly?
faq.answer: Poppins and Lora fonts must be pre-installed in your environment. The skill provides Arial and Georgia as automatic fallbacks.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my files?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidelines only. The AI assistant applies the colors and fonts based on your instructions to your chosen tool.
